text: hey everybody Thomas Joseph here now do
you want to take your boiled shrimp from
these tightly coiled tough shrimp to
perfectly tender and flavorful shrimp
today I'm going to show you the
foolproof method in making boiled shrimp
and actually the trick is to employ a
gentler cooking process and that is
poaching now what is poaching well it is
cooking in a flavorful liquid at a lower
temperature so in a pot here I have
water with a lot of aromatics of some
lemon herbs and some celery and carrots
in this pot so I'm gonna bring this up
to a boil a rolling boil and then I'm
ready to cook my shrimp
so my poaching liquid has come to a boil
and I'm using 1620s and that means that
there are sixteen or twenty shrimp per
pound now when you buy shrimp
you should really buy them by the number
as opposed to buying them by the name
there are a lot of names out there large
extra-large jumbo you really know what
you're getting when you buy by the
number now I have the shell on the
shrimp that is one trick in achieving a
very flavorful shrimp because the shell
actually gives a lot of flavor so not
only do we have a poaching liquid that
adds flavor but cooking with the shell
on as well does that so this needs to
come up to almost a boil and that'll
take about a minute and a half and then
the shrimp are completely done today I'm
using fresh shrimp now what is widely
available that would be frozen shrimp
but frozen shrimp the texture sometimes
it changes shrimp can be a little mushy
if it's frozen so if you can find fresh
shrimp at your supermarket I really
encourage you to buy it
so my poaching liquid is almost back to
a boil I'm going to take one of the
shrimp out and test it and this is
really the only way in which you know if
your shrimp are done just going to dunk
it in some cold water so I can handle it
it's opaque throughout it's not rubbery
and so that means that that these shrimp
are ready to go so I have an ice bath
here this will stop the cooking process
so our shrimp will not overcook so now
for the final step and that is peeling
and deveining the shrimp so what
my fingers I like to remove the shell I
usually start at one end now it's up to
you whether you like to keep the tail on
for presentation or if you would like to
remove that I'm going to keep the tail
on and then for removing the vein take a
sharp paring knife glide it along the
back you don't want to cut too far into
the shrimp and now remove the vein that
runs down the back now you might need to
dunk the shrimp and a little bit of that
cold water to rinse it out so there you
go a nice clean shrimp now you want to
make sure that you chill this before
you're ready to serve it with some
cocktail sauce and a squeeze of lemon
you have a delicious shrimp cocktail but
you guys you can use these in any way a
shrimp salad a shrimp sandwich now you
have the foolproof method in making
shrimp there you go enjoy
